BSG1-144.title: Astral Queen
BSG1-144.subtitle: Prison Ship
BSG1-144.abilityText: All defending personnel you control gain +1 power.
BSG1-144.flavorText: "The prisoners have full control of the Astral Queen.... It's their ship." —Capt. Adama

BSG1-145.subtitle: Cruise Ship
BSG1-145.abilityText: Each time you lose influence, you may commit this ship to reduce that loss by 1.
BSG1-145.flavorText: "Live, from Cloud 9, the most luxurious cruise ship in the fleet, it's The Colonial Gang!" —James McManus

BSG1-147.subtitle: Colonial Viper 113
BSG1-147.flavorText: A pilot unprepared for the enormous acceleration potential of the Colonial Viper could easily apply control inputs that result in maneuvers that would pulverize his or her body.

BSG1-148.subtitle: Colonial Viper 229
BSG1-148.flavorText: Flight instructors often warn new Colonial Viper pilots, "This thing can kill you."

BSG1-149.subtitle: Colonial Viper 315
BSG1-149.abilityText: Sniper (Each time this ship challenges, you may choose the defender.)
BSG1-149.flavorText: The Colonial Viper's thrust-to-weight ratio is beyond impressive—it's actually dangerous.

BSG1-150.subtitle: Colonial Viper 442
BSG1-150.flavorText: Most of Galactica's Mark VII Colonial Vipers were lost to Cylon cyber-attacks during the sneak attack on the Twelve Colonies of Kobol.

BSG1-151.subtitle: Colonial Viper 516
BSG1-151.flavorText: The Colonial Viper Mark VII is designed for ultrafast maneuvering in both space and atmospheric environments.

BSG1-152.subtitle: Colonial Viper 670
BSG1-152.abilityText: Sniper (Each time this ship challenges, you may choose the defender.)
BSG1-152.flavorText: The Colonial Viper Mark VII is a high-performance fighter.

BSG1-153.subtitle: Colonial Viper 762
BSG1-153.abilityText: Each time this ship challenges, you may commit target Pilot you control. If you do, this ship gets +3 power.
BSG1-153.flavorText: Battlestar Galactica currently has very few operational Mark VII Colonial Vipers.

BSG1-154.subtitle: Colonial Viper Squadron 800
BSG1-154.flavorText: "The CAP is the fleet's only defense. If all our Vipers are frakking around on the moon when the Cylons come calling, we're maggot meat." —Col. Tigh

BSG1-155.subtitle: Colonial Viper Squadron 900
BSG1-155.flavorText: "Sir, alert Vipers away. Gun captains report weapons manned and ready." —Lt. Gaeta

BSG1-156.subtitle: Freighter
BSG1-156.abilityText: Commit and exhaust: Put target Cylon card from your discard pile into your hand.
BSG1-156.flavorText: "There's an urgent call from the captain of the Gemenon Traveller.... He says they've found a Cylon on board." —Billy Keikeya

BSG1-157.subtitle: Hunting Raider
BSG1-157.abilityText: Sniper (Each time this ship challenges, you may choose the defender.)
BSG1-157.cylonThreatText: Each player puts the top card of his or her deck into his or her discard pile.

BSG1-158.subtitle: Luxury Liner
BSG1-158.flavorText: These vessels rank among the poshest ways to travel between the Twelve Colonies.

BSG1-159.subtitle: Mining Ship
BSG1-159.abilityText: Commit: Reveal the top two cards of your deck. Target opponent chooses one to go on the bottom of your deck. Put the other into your hand.

BSG1-160.subtitle: Doomed Liner
BSG1-160.abilityText: Exhaust: Return target Cylon unit you control to its owner's hand.
BSG1-160.cylonThreatText: Each player commits a ship he or she controls.
BSG1-160.flavorText: "Olympic Carrier/Boomer. I've been directed to ask how you escaped from the Cylons." —Lt. Valerii

BSG1-161.subtitle: Ordnance Freighter
BSG1-161.abilityText: Each time you spend a resource stack, you may commit this ship. If you do, generate [security].

BSG1-162.subtitle: Passenger Cruiser
BSG1-162.flavorText: "The captain of the Rising Star was...a little puzzled as to how you got aboard." —Cmdr. Adama

BSG1-163.subtitle: Raptor 101
BSG1-163.flavorText: This dynamic craft has demonstrated an adaptability that far exceeds its original design specifications.

BSG1-164.subtitle: Raptor 227
BSG1-164.flavorText: The Colonial Raptor has been used as a troop carrier for ship-to-ship boarding operations.

BSG1-165.subtitle: Raptor 342
BSG1-165.abilityText: Manipulate (Each time this ship challenges and there is no defender, you may gain influence equal to its power instead of your opponent losing influence.)
BSG1-165.flavorText: Raptors are crewed by a pilot and an electronic countermeasures officer (ECO).

BSG1-166.subtitle: Raptor 478
BSG1-166.abilityText: Manipulate (Each time this ship challenges and there is no defender, you may gain influence equal to its power instead of your opponent losing influence.)
BSG1-166.flavorText: Two Person Crew Carrier Based Stealth Scout Ship —Raptor specifications

BSG1-167.subtitle: Raptor 563
BSG1-167.flavorText: Vertical Take Off and Landing Capable —Raptor specifications

BSG1-168.subtitle: Raptor 689
BSG1-168.abilityText: Scramble (This ship can defend as though it were a personnel.)

BSG1-169.subtitle: Raptor 757
BSG1-169.abilityText: Manipulate (Each time this ship challenges and there is no defender, you may gain influence equal to its power instead of your opponent losing influence.)

BSG1-170.subtitle: Raptor 816
BSG1-170.abilityText: While defending, this ship gets +1 power.
BSG1-170.flavorText: Full Sensor Kit DRADIS Array —Raptor specifications

BSG1-171.subtitle: Scouting Raider
BSG1-171.abilityText: When this card enters play as a ship, look at the top card of target deck.
BSG1-171.cylonThreatText: Each player puts a card from his or her hand on top of his or her deck.

BSG1-172.subtitle: Skirmishing Raider
BSG1-172.abilityText: Each time this ship challenges, sacrifice it when that challenge ends.

BSG1-173.subtitle: Space Park
BSG1-173.abilityText: Commit: Look at the top card of your deck. You may put that card on the bottom of your deck.
BSG1-173.flavorText: This early luxury-liner design was so successful that it was also adapted for scientific and military uses.

BSG1-174.subtitle: Supply Freighter
BSG1-174.abilityText: Each time you spend a resource stack, you may commit this ship. If you do, generate [logistics].

BSG1-175.subtitle: Troop Freighter
BSG1-175.abilityText: Each time you spend a resource stack, you may commit this ship. If you do, generate [persuasion].

BSG2-156.subtitle: Pouncing Raider
BSG2-156.abilityText: Scramble (This unit can defend as a personnel or a ship.)
BSG2-156.cylonThreatText: Each player exhausts a reserve unit he or she controls.
BSG2-156.flavorText: "Action stations, action stations: Cylon Raider approaching." —PO 2nd Class Anastasia "Dee" Dualla

BSG2-131.subtitle: Assault Heavy Raider
BSG2-131.abilityText: Manipulate (Each time this unit challenges and there is no defender, you can gain influence equal to its power instead of your opponent losing influence.)
BSG2-131.flavorText: "Apollo reports Heavy Raider impact on starboard flight pod." —PO 2nd Class Anastasia "Dee" Dualla

BSG2-132.title: Astral Queen
BSG2-132.subtitle: Hitch in the Plan
BSG2-132.abilityText: Commit: Commit and exhaust target unresolved mission.
BSG2-132.flavorText: "Thank you for your offer. We respectfully decline." —Tom Zarek

BSG2-133.title: Astral Queen
BSG2-133.subtitle: Platform for Revolution
BSG2-133.abilityText: Commit and exhaust: Exhaust two target personnel.
BSG2-133.flavorText: "The crew are my prisoners. They will not be harmed, but I have two conditions before I release my captives." —Tom Zarek

BSG2-134.title: Captured Heavy Raider
BSG2-134.subtitle: Boomer's Ride
BSG2-134.abilityText: Strafe (This unit can challenge as a personnel or a ship. Make this choice before the defender is chosen.)
BSG2-134.cylonThreatText: Each player chooses a personnel card from his or her discard pile and puts that card into his or her hand.

BSG2-135.title: Captured Raider
BSG2-135.subtitle: Kara's Pet
BSG2-135.abilityText: While you control an alert Starbuck, this ship gets +1 power.
BSG2-135.cylonThreatText: Each player readies a ship he or she controls.
BSG2-135.flavorText: "Worth a try, sir. I mean, it did fly for you—and hasn't made so much as a grunt since." —Chief Galen Tyrol

BSG2-136.title: Cloud 9
BSG2-136.subtitle: Transport Hub
BSG2-136.abilityText: Commit: Commit and exhaust target defending personnel you control. The challenge ends and the challenger is committed.
BSG2-136.flavorText: "Sir, if they dock, we may lose them." —Lt. Felix Gaeta

BSG2-137.title: Cloud 9
BSG2-137.subtitle: Vacation Ship
BSG2-137.abilityText: All Civilian units you control get +1 power.
BSG2-137.flavorText: "Live, from Cloud 9, the most luxurious cruise ship in the fleet." —James McManus

BSG2-138.title: Colonial One
BSG2-138.subtitle: Administration Headquarters
BSG2-138.abilityText: All Politicians you control get +1 power.

BSG2-139.title: Colonial One
BSG2-139.subtitle: The President's Ship
BSG2-139.abilityText:
This ship cannot challenge. (This ship can defend.)

Commit: Target player gains 1 influence.
BSG2-139.flavorText: "This is Colonial Heavy 798—no, strike that. This is Colonial One." —Pilot, Colonial One

BSG2-140.subtitle: Colonial Viper 0205
BSG2-140.abilityText: Commit: Target other ship gets +2 power.

BSG2-141.subtitle: Colonial Viper 1026
BSG2-141.flavorText: "I want all Vipers manned and ready." —Cmdr. William Adama

BSG2-142.subtitle: Colonial Viper 1104
BSG2-142.abilityText: During the Cylon phase, this ship gets +2 power.
BSG2-142.flavorText: "Apollo. Tally two Cylon Raiders, close formation." —Capt. Lee "Apollo" Adama

BSG2-143.subtitle: Colonial Viper 1110
BSG2-143.abilityText: Scramble (This unit can defend as a personnel or a ship.)
BSG2-143.flavorText: "All Vipers, report back to Galactica." —Capt. George Birch

BSG2-144.subtitle: Colonial Viper 2220
BSG2-144.flavorText: "As maneuverable as a jackrabbit and can flip end for end in point-three-five seconds." —Lt. Kara "Starbuck" Thrace

BSG2-145.subtitle: Colonial Viper 4267
BSG2-145.abilityText: While defending, this ship gets +1 power.
BSG2-145.flavorText: "Without the CAP, isn't the fleet defenseless?" —President Laura Roslin

BSG2-146.subtitle: Colonial Viper 7961
BSG2-146.abilityText:
Sniper (Each time this unit challenges, you can choose the defender.)
Strafe (This unit can challenge as a personnel or a ship. Make this choice before the defender is chosen.)

BSG2-147.subtitle: Cruising Heavy Raider
BSG2-147.cylonThreatText: Each player commits a ship he or she controls.
BSG2-147.flavorText: "A Heavy Raider makes a regular refueling stop every afternoon, like clockwork." —Samuel Anders

BSG2-148.title: Galactica
BSG2-148.subtitle: Defender of the Fleet
BSG2-148.flavorText: "They're all so immensely grateful to all of you on Galactica. You're literally our saviors." —Ellen Tigh

BSG2-149.title: Galactica
BSG2-149.subtitle: Launch Platform
BSG2-149.abilityText: All Fighters you control get +1 power.

BSG2-150.title: Gideon
BSG2-150.subtitle: Rebellious Transport
BSG2-150.flavorText: "Seven other container ships are refusing to release their supplies as well." —Lt. Felix Gaeta

BSG2-151.subtitle: Heavy Transport
BSG2-151.flavorText: "Colonial Movers — we move anywhere." —Colonial Movers Corporation slogan

BSG2-152.subtitle: Menacing Raider
BSG2-152.abilityText:
Sniper (Each time this unit challenges, you can choose the defender.)
Strafe (This unit can challenge as a personnel or a ship. Make this choice before the defender is chosen.)
BSG2-152.cylonThreatText: Each player commits a unit he or she controls.

BSG2-153.subtitle: Nuclear-Armed Raider
BSG2-153.abilityText: Each time this ship wins a challenge, defeat target asset that has no supply cards.
BSG2-153.flavorText: "Does that mean the first wave of Raiders is ignoring the decoys and coming after us?" —Dr. Gaius Baltar

BSG2-154.title: Olympic Carrier
BSG2-154.subtitle: Trojan Horse
BSG2-154.abilityText: When you resolve a Cylon mission, you can sacrifice this ship. If you do, it meets any two of the mission's requirements.
BSG2-154.flavorText: "The Olympic Carrier has been infiltrated by Cylon agents." —Number Six

BSG2-155.subtitle: Pan-Galactic Luxury Liner
BSG2-155.flavorText: "All civilian ships are away." —Lt. Felix Gaeta

BSG2-157.subtitle: Pursuing Raider
BSG2-157.cylonThreatText: Each player exhausts an asset he or she controls that has no supply cards.
BSG2-157.flavorText: "Base Star is launching Raiders." —Lt. Felix Gaeta

BSG2-158.subtitle: Raptor 168
BSG2-158.flavorText: "Raptor pilots sing their songs . . . I just love to drop my bombs!" —Popular Raptor pilot song

BSG2-159.subtitle: Raptor 203
BSG2-159.flavorText: "Raptor pilots flying high . . . Raptor pilots flying by!" —Popular Raptor pilot song

BSG2-160.subtitle: Raptor 312
BSG2-160.abilityText: Vulnerable (Personnel and ships can defend against this unit.)
BSG2-160.flavorText: "Three little Cylons in the air . . . watch their metal burn and flare!" —Popular Raptor pilot song

BSG2-161.subtitle: Raptor 432
BSG2-161.abilityText: When you are challenged by a ship, you can play this card from your hand into your reserve area. It can defend against the challenger.
BSG2-161.flavorText: "We'll have Raptors prepositioned to keep an eye on the Cylons." —Lt. Kara "Starbuck" Thrace

BSG2-162.subtitle: Raptor 659
BSG2-162.abilityText: Commit: Target other ship gains Strafe. (This unit can challenge as a personnel or a ship. Make this choice before the defender is chosen.)
BSG2-162.flavorText: "Raptor pilots in the sun . . . Raptor pilots out for fun!" —Popular Raptor pilot song

BSG2-163.subtitle: Raptor 719
BSG2-163.abilityText:
Sniper (Each time this unit challenges, you can choose the defender.)

Strafe (This unit can challenge as a personnel or a ship. Make this choice before the defender is chosen.)

BSG2-164.subtitle: Refinery Ship
BSG2-164.abilityText: Commit and exhaust: Take an extra action after this one. On your next action, reduce the cost of playing a card by one of any resource.
BSG2-164.flavorText: "The refinery ship will have to work overtime." —President Laura Roslin

BSG2-165.subtitle: Shuttle
BSG2-165.flavorText: "Get me a shuttle to Cloud 9." —President Laura Roslin
